name: Aaron Sumner
tagline: Resourceful Rubyist and web application developer
body:
## Introduction

My name is Aaron Sumner, of Lawrence, Kansas, USA; by way of Seattle, Washington, and Jersey County, Illinois.

I'm a long-time web developer, at it since 1994 when I began creating some of the very first departmental and organizational websites as an undergraduate at the University of Kansas. Over the years I've worked my way through static HTML to Applescript (yes, Applescript) to Perl to PHP to Ruby. Since 2005 I've worked mostly with Ruby and Rails, with a dose of JavaScript.

I'm an independent author with an introduction to the RSpec test framework to my credit. I also blog about Rails on occasion.

By day I manage web and educational technology research and development at the University of Kansas Center for Research on Learning. I've also worked past stints at the University of Washington, the University of Kansas Medical Center, and as a freelance software developer. To date most of my work has been done in the public and non-profit sectors; particularly in education. I hold a bachelor's degree in Journalism from the University of Kansas, and a master's degree in Instructional Design and Technology from Emporia State University.

On the side I enjoy photography, baseball, college basketball, music and bowling.

## Strengths

Communicating clearly between diverse teams to ensure that project deadlines are met and development moves forward satisfactorily.

Using limited resources intelligently to develop high-quality solutions to meet a given project's needs.

Performing root cause analyses to fully understand the nature of a problem, in order to arrive at the best solution possible given any constraints.

Leveraging a diverse background, including my educational background in journalism and instructional design, when developing solutions to the problems at hand.

## Technical expertise

**Backend:** Ruby on Rails, some Sinatra, MySQL, a little PostgreSQL. I've also begun dabbling in Python for data science purposes.

**Frontend:** HTML5, CSS3, Haml, Sass, jQuery, Bootstrap, some CoffeeScript. I'd really like to continue improving my skills in this arena, and have begun looking at Angular.js and Ember.js.

**Testing:** RSpec, Cucumber, MiniTest, TestUnit.

**Development:** Mac OS X, Git, TextMate, Vim when I have to.

**Deployment:** Capistrano, Apache, Passenger, Ubuntu Server, Linode, Heroku. Getting into Puppet and Chef.

## Experience

#### Director of Technology for Research and Development/Project Manager (2005-present)

*University of Kansas Center for Research on Learning, Lawrence KS*

Design and implement web software for education research projects using Ruby on Rails, MySQL, RSpec, jQuery, Sass, and Haml. Administer multiple Linux and Mac OS X web and database servers. Managed a team of programmers and educational technologists. Serve as technology expert during grant proposal writing activities. Represent CRL at national and regional education conferences.

#### Senior Computing Specialist (2002-2005)

*University of Washington Department of Psychology, Seattle WA*

Developed the departmental website using PHP, MySQL, CSS, and HTML. Administered Linux and Mac OS X web and database servers. Managed all classroom technology for the department, including four computer labs. Nominated for UW Employee of the Year, 2005.

#### Technology Coordinator (2000-2002)

*University of Kansas Center for Research on Learning, Lawrence KS*

Developed web-based publishing systems and data tracking tools using PHP, MySQL, CSS, and HTML. Created online-ready learning content using Flash and JavaScript. Administered Linux servers, networks, and Macintosh and Windows-based labs. Represented CRL at national education conferences.

#### Web Developer (1999-2000)

*University of Kansas Medical Center, Kansas City KS*

Created web software for public, campus, and departmental purposes using Perl, VBScript, SQL, HTML, and Java. Developed a web-based bridge to the hospitalâ€™s directory assistance software and tools for tracking DMCA complaints. Assisted in the administration of Unix and NT servers.

#### Network Communications Coordinator (1996-1999)

*University of Kansas Department of Special Education, Lawrence KS*

Designed and developed web software and sites using Perl, SQL, and HTML. Wrote early web-based project management, content management, and surveying tools. Managed Unix-based servers, networks, and Macintosh-based labs.

## Education

#### Master of Science, 2008
Instructional Design and Technology  
Emporia State University, Emporia KS

Journalism  
University of Kansas, Lawrence KS

## Example Projects

#### Everyday Rails Testing with RSpec (2012-present)

*[Everyday Rails Testing with RSpec](https://leanpub.com/everydayrailsrspec)* is a self-published introduction to testing Rails applications using RSpec, Factory Girl, and Capybara. To date it has sold nearly 2,000 copies and is one of the more popular titles available on Leanpub.

#### Hoxie (2011-present)

[Hoxie](https://hoxie.stratepedia.org/) helps researchers and school administrators collect and analyze data on the implementation of academic interventions in classrooms.

#### Project Success (2011-present)

[Project Success](https://kansasprojectsuccess.org/) is a web-based, curated directory of resources for special education instructors in Kansas. I developed it from the ground up using Rails.

#### Everyday Rails (2010-present)

[Everyday Rails](http://everydayrails.com/) is a blog I write with tutorials and advice for beginner and intermediate Rails developers.
